column4: I just got a "the package system is broken" error, how would I fix this?
can you give a pastebin of: sudo apt-get update
what is a pastebin?
ubottu http://paste.ubuntu.com/633937/
what about after that?
you may need to define resolutions ni the screen section
that was the last of it. I'll do that now
my resolutions are fine
sorry, crossed wire

the command had no effect, I closed the error message about the broken package system, and the same error message popped up again. it says to disable third party repositories (idk wtf they are) and to run the command  apt-get install -f. I'll pastebin the results of running that command
ok try:   sudo apt-get --reinstall install nano
does it install ok?
it seemed to install okay.
ok does:  sudo apt-get -y upgrade    run ok?
seemed to. it doesn't really say if it was succesful or not.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/633944/
you'd see some blatant errors and such
oh, well no errors except for unknown media types
still getting package system broken error messages.
try:  !ask | andr0-mr      ;)
I failed...
but now you know, so it's ok
do you know how to manually mount a drive
